title: Marketing Specialist
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



Sell More Homes | Tech Specialist | Full-Time



Sell More Homes is a 7-figure marketing and coaching company that helps real estate agents across North America systemize their businesses, and close more deals using Meta/YouTube ads, HighLevel CRM, AI, and virtual assistants.



Weâ€™re looking for a Tech Specialist to join our winning team! If you're a pro at marketing tech, CRM systems, and love helping others succeed, this role might be for you.



What Youâ€™ll Do:



Onboard New Clients:

Serve as the first tech touchpoint for new clients. You'll walk them through onboarding sessions, help them set up or connect their Meta 
) ad accounts and HighLevel CRM.



CRM Setup:

Set up and customize HighLevel CRM accounts for new clients â€“ including pipelines, automations, integrations, workflows, and more.



Support & Troubleshooting:

Provide tech guidance, answer client questions about tools and integrations, and troubleshoot setup issues as needed.



---



What Weâ€™re Looking For:



* Proven experience with marketing platforms (especially Meta Ads and GoHighLevel CRM)

* Comfortable guiding non-technical clients through tech setup

* Excellent communication, organization, and follow-through

* A proactive team player who can manage multiple onboarding clients at once

* Detail-oriented and process-driven

* Fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment

* Bonus: experience in real estate, digital marketing, or SaaS onboarding



---



Why Join Sell More Homes?



* Play a vital role in a fast-growing, impact-driven company

* Learn directly from a high-performing team and visionary founder

* Be part of a real estate marketing agency that recently earned HighLevel Gold SaaS status (2024) â€“ and weâ€™re aiming for Platinum in 2025

* Opportunity to grow into operations, client success, or product roles

* Work with passionate real estate professionals across North America

* 100% remote



---

title: Social Media Creative Producer
description:
This is a full-time position as a social media creative producer. You will work directly with the lead media buyer to create social media ads & videos to be published on organic/paid social platforms. Mostly Meta.



You need to understand why ads work. 

Understanding of direct response principles for service businesses.



-Problem ? agitation ? solution.

-Pain-led hooks, not brand fluff.

-Clear offer, clear CTA.

-Ability to think in angles, not just ideas.

-Emotional angles (fear, relief, hope, identity).

-Logical angles (cost, time, outcomes, alternatives).

-Awareness of platforms like Meta, TikTok, YouTube Shorts.

-Knows what works in-feed vs polished ads.

-Understands thumb-stop patterns.



Storyboarding & Creative Direction

-Turn an idea into a clear shot-by-shot plan.

-Specify, visuals, on-screen text, voiceover, b-roll ideas, all for AI asset creation. 

-Design ads that can be assembled from existing footage or created by AI. 

-Simple & clear structures. 



Editing

-Short-form editing for ads. Fast pacing, jump cuts, captions that get read. 

-Knows how to cut dead air, add pattern interrupts, optimize for mobile viewing. 



Testing

-Comfortable with testing, iterations, rapid feedback loops. 

-The goal is learning velocity.



Other

-Strong communication skills. 

-Flexible creative style, willingness to try new ideas. 

-Punctual and honest. 

-Strong work ethic. 



Note: This is a full-time position. Moonlighting or having another job or contract will not be acceptable. Do not apply if you fall under these conditions. 



To apply, please link 2-3 examples of your video work for service-based businesses and/or SAAS.

title: Part-Time WordPress + SEO VA (Web Developer / SEO Specialist)
description:
Job Overview



Weâ€™re hiring a part-time WordPress + SEO VA to help maintain and improve our website, publish/optimize content, and grow organic traffic through clean technical SEO and on-page best practices.



This is an ongoing role (not a one-time project). Youâ€™ll work directly with the owner and help implement web updates quickly, keep things organized, and track improvements over time.



Responsibilities



WordPress / Website

 â€¢ Update and maintain WordPress pages (Elementor or Gutenbergâ€”tell us what you use)

 â€¢ Create new pages/landing pages from provided copy and structure

 â€¢ Improve page speed, mobile responsiveness, and basic UX

 â€¢ Add tracking pixels / scripts when needed (GA4, Meta, etc.)

 â€¢ Troubleshoot common plugin/theme issues and site errors

 â€¢ Basic security + backups coordination (plugin-based)



SEO (On-Page + Technical + Local)

 â€¢ On-page SEO for service pages + blog posts (titles, headings, internal linking, image alt text, schema where appropriate)

 â€¢ Technical SEO checks (indexing, sitemaps, redirects, broken links, canonical tags)

 â€¢ Keyword research for local service SEO (Seattle/King County focus)

 â€¢ Optimize Google Business Profile basics (as needed)

 â€¢ Create simple monthly reporting: rankings, traffic, top pages, wins + next actions



Required Skills

 â€¢ Strong WordPress experience (you can build/edit pages confidently)

title: Photo Editor & Graphic Designer
description:
Part-Time or Project-Based



About Us

KG Studios Photography is a Southern California studio specializing in sports, team, and individual portraits. We work with large programs, photographing anywhere from 15 to 600 athletes in a short amount of time. Our goal is to deliver photos within 10 days and banners within a 5-day turnaround. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a skilled Photo Editor & Designer to join our creative team.



About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented Photo Editor & Designer who excels in high-volume photo editing, color correction, and creative design. You will work closely with Me, the owner and main photographer, to ensure every image and graphic meets our brandâ€™s visual standards and supports our clientsâ€™ needs.



Key Responsibilities

Edit and retouch photos for color, exposure, and dynamic impact

Perform advanced extractions (cut-outs, background removal, compositing)

Design banners, posters, and custom graphics for print and digital use

Collaborate with the team to maintain consistent style and quality

Prepare files for print and digital delivery (correct sizing, resolution, and format)

Meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously (10-day photo delivery, 5-day banner turnaround)

Organize programs and project details using Excel or Google Sheets



Required Skills & Experience

Proficient in Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom

Willingness to learn new photo editing programs

Strong portfolio of edited images and design projects

Skilled in color correction, retouching, and dynamic photo enhancement

Experience with extractions and compositing

Ability to design banners, posters, and marketing graphics

Detail-oriented, organized, and able to follow creative direction

Experience in sports or team photography editing is a plus

Comfortable with high-volume, fast-paced workflows

Proficient in Excel or Google Sheets for organizing programs

Willingness to learn new programs and tools as needed



Working Hours & Compensation

Part-time or project-based (flexible hours)

Remote work

Compensation based on experience and project scope



How to Apply

Send your resume and a brief cover letter. Please include:

A portfolio showcasing your photo editing and design work

Examples of photos you have personally photographed (if applicable)

A list of editing/design programs you have used

Your experience with Excel or Google Sheets

A statement about your willingness to learn new programs

Any experience with sports or team photography, banner design, or advanced retouching



You will work closely with the owner and lead photographer. We look forward to seeing how your creative skills can help KG Studios deliver outstanding images and products to our clients!

About Us

We are a U.S.-based AI video production company located in Rhode Island. We serve clients in real estate, insurance, brand storytelling, and character-driven animation. We've been in video production since 2019 and have worked with high-profile clients across multiple industries.

This is a permanent, salaried position with daily work. We have long-term client partnerships that guarantee consistent production year-round. We are building a team â€” not cycling through freelancers.

About the salary range: We listed a wide range because we're open to different experience levels. If you're a strong traditional editor who's eager to grow into AI video, we'll start you at a fair rate and invest in your development. If you're already producing broadcast-quality AI video and can hit the ground running, we'll pay accordingly â€” up to $3,500/month for the right person. We believe in paying well for excellent work.



Why This Job Is Different

We provide ALL AI tools and software subscriptions. You will not need to pay for any AI video platforms out of pocket. Once you're part of the team, we give you full access to the tools you need â€” including platforms like Sora, VEO, Kling, Runway, Pika, HeyGen, and others as needed. We also provide Adobe Creative Cloud if required.

We know these tools are expensive. We invest in our team so you can focus on doing great work instead of worrying about subscription costs.

What else we offer:



Monthly salary starting at $500/month for promising candidates, scaling up to $3,500/month for top performers â€” we pay for results and commitment, not just hours

Salary paid consistently (weekly during your first 2 months, then bi-monthly)

13th month bonus in December

All AI tool subscriptions and software covered by us

Training on our specific workflows and client standards

Real career growth â€” we promote from within and reward strong performers with raises and leadership opportunities

Payment via Wise, PayPal, or your preferred method





What You'll Be Doing

Your day-to-day work will include:



Creating AI-generated video content using multiple platforms â€” selecting the right tool for each creative challenge

Building and animating realistic digital avatars with accurate lip sync, natural facial expressions, and believable body language

Editing and polishing final videos in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve â€” including transitions, motion graphics, captions, color correction, and audio mixing

Translating scripts and client briefs into visual content across corporate, cinematic, and commercial styles

Quality-checking every deliverable for consistency in character appearance, lighting, pacing, and overall professional standard





Who We're Looking For

We need someone who treats AI as a creative tool, not a shortcut. The right person has three qualities:

1. High standards for quality. You notice artifacts, background warping, unnatural blinking, and lip sync issues before anyone else. Color correction and lighting continuity are part of your process from the start â€” not finishing touches.

2. Understanding of AI video tools. You don't need to own subscriptions to every platform, but you should understand what different AI video tools can do and how they compare. If you've used free tiers, watched breakdowns, experimented during trials, or studied these tools closely â€” that counts. We will give you full access once you're on the team.

3. Strong post-production skills. Creating the AI clip is only half the job. Editing, pacing, sound design, compositing, and storytelling are the other half. You should be comfortable and confident in Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve.



Technical Requirements



Hands-on experience or demonstrated knowledge of 2 or more AI video platforms (HeyGen, Kling, VEO, Runway, Midjourney, Pika, Sora, etc.)

Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects (or DaVinci Resolve)

Portfolio showing strong visual storytelling, pacing, and compositional sense

Clear English communication â€” you'll interpret creative briefs and collaborate directly with our team

Reliable internet connection and a computer capable of running video editing software smoothly





How to Apply â€” Please Read Carefully

We review every application personally. To help us find the right person, please include the following in your application:

1. Show us your work. Share 2-3 video samples. We are looking for:



AI-generated video work if you have it (even free-tier or watermarked samples are fine â€” we understand tool access is limited)

Polished post-production work (editing, color, motion graphics, sound design)

Avatar-focused or character-driven examples will put you at the top of the list

If you don't have AI video samples, show us your strongest traditional editing work AND explain which AI video tools you've studied or experimented with and what you know about their strengths and limitations



2. Tell us why this role fits you. In a few sentences (not a copy-paste cover letter), explain what about this position matches where you are in your career and why you're looking for something permanent.

3. Include the word "Storyboard" at the beginning of your application so we know you read the full post.

Important: Applications without any work samples will not be reviewed. You don't need a perfect portfolio â€” but we need to see evidence of your skills and your eye for quality.

title: SEO & GEO Content Writer / Blog Manager
description:
About Us:

We're a fast-growing US-based DTC brand in the health and wellness space. We make a high-protein dessert mix that's easy to make at home, tastes amazing, and has great macros with zero added sugar. People love it. Nearly 7,000 customers in under 9 months and growing every week.



We're building our blog from scratch and need a solid writer to help us own organic search for topics like protein desserts, healthy recipes, and nutrition. You'd be getting in early at a brand that's taking off. You'll work directly with me (the founder), not a manager or agency.



To get a feel for what we're going for, check out Vital Proteins' blog: 
 -- We want that kind of quality, but for our brand and audience.



What You'll Be Doing:



Blog Content

- Writing and publishing articles in Shopify (5-8 per week at first while we build out the blog, then 2-3 per week ongoing)

- Two types of content: recipe posts (protein dessert recipes with instructions, ingredients, nutritional info) and health/wellness articles (protein, nutrition, healthy eating, fitness-friendly)

- Helping shape the blog structure, categories, and content direction from the ground up



SEO & GEO

- This is the most important part of the role.

- Keyword research and topic planning based on what people are actually searching for

- Writing content that ranks in Google AND shows up in AI-generated answers (Google AI Overviews, ChatGPT, Perplexity). This is called Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) and it's a big deal for us.

- On-page SEO: internal linking, meta descriptions, heading structure, search intent, E-E-A-T principles

- If SEO and GEO aren't your thing, this role probably isn't the right fit.



 Content

- Helping put together a weekly recipe
 and occasional newsletter content (we use Klaviyo)

- Repurposing blog content into
-friendly format



Images

- Sourcing and formatting images for posts (we have stock photo access, and experience with AI image generation tools is a plus)



Where This Role Could Grow:

As we scale, there's room to take on social media content, landing page copy, and broader marketing work. Not required now, but if you have that experience, great.



Who You Are:

- Native-level English writing skills (not just conversational)

- Real SEO experience. You've done keyword research, you understand search intent, you've written content that ranks. Not a beginner.

- Familiar with GEO or ready to learn it quickly

- Comfortable publishing in Shopify

- Experience writing about health, food, or nutrition is a big plus

- Self-starter. You can take a topic and run with it.

- You use AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, etc.) to work smarter. We're all for it. We just care that the final product sounds human and is actually useful, not generic AI slop.

- Reliable. You show up, you hit deadlines, and if something comes up, you tell me. Simple as that.



Pay & Details:



- $7-$9/hour depending on experience

- 20-30 hours/week to start, room to grow

- Long-term role. We want someone who grows with us.

- You work directly with the founder

- Real opportunity to grow into a bigger content marketing role



How to Apply:

- Please include the word "chocolate" in the first line of your application so I know you read this entire post. :)



Then please tell me:

1) Quick intro and your content/SEO experience

2) Links to 5-10 writing samples (health, food, or lifestyle preferred. If anything ranks well, mention it.)

3) Your rate expectation

4) Availability (hours per day, timezone)

5) What AI tools do you use and how?



Thank you!

title: Virtual Executive Assistant to the CEO (Philippines-Based)
description:
Remote | 30â€“40 hours/week | Long-Term Position



I am hiring a high-level Virtual Executive Assistant based in the Philippines to become my right hand.



This is a long-term position for someone who wants to learn by close collaboration with a CEO, and the opportunity to grow alongside both a company and a personal brand.



Important context:

I have worked with a Philippines-based team since 2017. Most of my team has stayed with me for years. I value loyalty, clear communication, and growth, and I am looking for someone who wants the same.



NOTE: This is not a basic VA role!



You will be supporting me directly as the CEO and will be deeply involved in:

- Daily operations

- Communication

- Organization

- Execution



I need someone who understands what it means to be a true executive assistant, someone who can eventually think ahead, anticipate needs, and run things without being micromanaged.



While the role is 30â€“40 hours per week, it requires high availability and strong communication. You will be in frequent contact with me throughout the day. This role works best for someone who is comfortable being closely connected to their executive.



Key Responsibilities

-
 and calendar management

- Daily task organization and prioritization

- Internal team communication and follow-ups

- Document creation and organization

- Working daily inside Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Calendar)

- Creating and editing materials in Canva (Plus: Above Creative Suite)

- Supporting basic social media-related tasks (I am fully in charge of my socials, this is NOT social media management role. You'll just support me when needed in this realm as well)

- Learning and managing new tools and platforms quickly

- Assisting with scheduling, planning, and coordination

- Supporting occasional travel logistics (willingness to travel is a plus)

- Acting as my second brain and operational support



Required Skills & Experience

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Strong communication skills and responsiveness

- Experience working as a VA or executive assistant

- Willingness and ability to learn new applications quickly

- Strong organization, attention to detail, and follow-through

- Ability to communicate professionally with a team

- Independent thinker who solves problems without waiting to be told

- Personality & Mindset Fit



This role is for someone who:

- Wants to grow into more responsibility

- Takes pride in doing things well

- Is proactive, reliable, and detail-oriented

- Wants a long-term role, not short-term work

- Understands that executive support requires flexibility and trust



I am looking for someone who wants to grow with the company and the personal brand, not just complete tasks.



Compensation & Growth

- Starting rate: $800+ per month

- Hours: 30â€“40 hours per week

- Raises based on performance, efficiency, and trust

- Long-term stability for the right person

- I invest in people who invest in the work.



Important Notes

- We already work successfully with a Philippines-based team and have done so since 2017

- This is a real career opportunity, not a temporary VA role

- High communication and responsiveness are required



How to Apply:

Please include:

- A short introduction about yourself

- Your experience as a VA or executive assistant

- Why you are interested in being a long-term right hand to a CEO

- Confirmation that you are comfortable with frequent communication and availability



Only serious, long-term applicants should apply.

The Role: Google Ads Account manager

OxBow USA is seeking a critical-thinking, data-driven Google Ads Specialist to own the technical management of 10â€“15 client accounts.



Unlike traditional agency roles, this is NOT a client-facing position. You will not be on client calls or managing
s with business owners. Instead, you will work directly with our internal Account Managers and Founders to execute high-level strategies, manage budgets, and optimize for results on the Google Ad accounts that OxBow manages for other business'

About Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners

Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners is a retained executive search firm based in the United States that partners with founder-led and investor-backed companies to recruit transformational financial and operational leaders. We specialize in acquiring top-tier talent across the C-suite and VP-levelâ€”particularly CFOs, COOs, and functional executivesâ€”who drive scalable growth and successful exits for high-growth businesses. Our clients are typically small to mid-market companies with revenues under $500M, most commonly between $1M and $200M, across industries like B2B services, software/SaaS, manufacturing, and financial services.



We are known for our white-glove, hands-on approach, our structured and transparent process, and our obsession with delivering results. We are now looking for a sharp, detail-oriented, and resourceful professional to join us in a critical research and administrative capacity.



Role Overview

The Executive Search Research Analyst & Administrative Coordinator will play a vital dual role supporting both candidate research and firm operations. This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the Founder in a high-touch executive search environment. Youâ€™ll be responsible for identifying talent, supporting active search engagements, and helping manage day-to-day operations that enable high-impact client delivery.



Key Responsibilities



Research & Candidate Identification



Build and maintain target lists, market maps, and org charts of executive leadership teams at relevant companies.



Conduct deep candidate sourcing using LinkedIn Recruiter, search strings, market intel, and research tools.



Monitor industry movement, executive transitions, and deal activity in private equity, venture capital, and M&A spaces to identify new opportunities and talent.



Compile and organize research briefs, company profiles, and competitor intelligence.



Candidate Process Support



Maintain detailed records in the firmâ€™s CRM/ATS (Loxo) and keep search pipelines up to date.



Support the development of candidate scorecards, summaries, and job transition documentation.



Assist in scheduling candidate interviews and preparing interview guides and presentations for clients.



Help manage reference checks, background verifications, and candidate communications.



Administrative & Operational Coordination



Provide executive support to the Founder including scheduling, inbox management, and project tracking.



Create, edit, and format client-facing documents including job profiles, pitch decks, and candidate presentations.



Track deliverables, project timelines, invoices, and status updates to ensure smooth execution across all searches.



Help improve internal documentation, templates, and SOPs as the firm scales.



Qualifications



Bachelorâ€™s degree required; preferred background in business, communications, or a research-intensive field.



2-5 years of experience in executive search, recruiting, research, or professional services preferred.



Exceptional attention to detail and organizational discipline.



Highly proficient with Google Workspace, LinkedIn Recruiter, and web-based research.



Familiarity with CRM/ATS platforms (e.g., Loxo) a plus.



Clear, concise writing and communication skills are essential.



Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.



Who You Are



A rigorous thinker with strong intellectual curiosity and follow-through.



A proactive contributor who thrives with autonomy and accountability.



A high-integrity professional who treats confidential information with discretion.



A behind-the-scenes operator who takes pride in enabling great work and building something meaningful.



Why Join Crimson Jay

Youâ€™ll be joining a founder-led firm in high-growth mode, working on mission-critical searches that shape the future of small and mid-sized companies. Youâ€™ll gain exposure to high-level executive leadership, private equity firms, and top-tier operatorsâ€”while building search and business operations experience in a performance-driven but human, flexible culture.

title: US Bookkeeper
description:
We are a growing bookkeeping firm based on the US West Coast (PST), and weâ€™re looking for a detail-oriented, proactive numbers enthusiast to join our team! We aren't just looking for someone to "input data." We want a partner who truly understands the "why" behind the numbers. If you love clean books, organized files, and helping small businesses thrive, weâ€™d love to meet you!



Key Tasks:

* Daily coding of transactions to the correct Chart of Accounts

* Recording and applying customer payments against invoices accurately, ensuring we match them correctly and don't a
 double-count income.

* Managing AP/AR, liability reconciliations, and bank reconciliations

* Preparing monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) that give our clients total peace of mind.

* We follow SOPs, but we love it when you suggest a more efficient way to get things done!



Requirements:

* Accounting degree or certified bookkeeper preferred

* 2+ years of US-based bookkeeping experience. You should be comfortable handling multiple client files at once and have a deep understanding of clearing accounts.

* Expert-level skills in QuickBooks Online and Xero (certification preferred)

* Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

* Advanced written and spoken English required. You must be comfortable discussing bookkeeping topics on live video calls and writing clear, professional messages to US clients.

* Reliable internet connection and computer

* Bonus points if you have hands-on experience using Double (formerly Keeper.app), Shopify, Amazon, Square, Stripe, Toast, Clover, or Google Workspace in a bookkeeping environment.



Work Schedule

* This is a part-time position (20 hours per week)

* For the first 2â€“4 weeks, we will work together during US Pacific Time (PST) hours for live training and real-time feedback.

* After training, you may work Philippine Standard Time hours; however, we require at least 1 hour of daily overlap with PST (Mondayâ€“Thursday) to ensure smooth communication and workflow alignment.



How To Apply (Applications without these will be ignored)

Please include all of the following:

1. A brief introduction (2-3 paragraphs max)

2. Your Quickbooks Online Experience

3. The types of US clients you have supported (industry & size)

4. Your experience working for a bookkeeping or accounting firm

5. Include your favorite color in the heading line.

title: AI-Driven Social Media & Content Virtual Assistant
description:
About Me



I am Yasmine Mahmoudieh â€” a globally recognized impact designer and architect working between Berlin, Milan and London.



My mission is to transform the way we build â€” replacing harmful materials with regenerative, sustainable alternatives. I work with developers, governments and global institutions and speak at platforms such as the World Economic Forum.



This is not just a job. It is a mission-driven role.

â€¢ LinkedIn (daily posts)

title: Capacity Planner
description:
Join the Aventus Team!

We are Aventus â€” a boutique customer experience BPO based in Charleston, South Carolina, with over a decade of delivering exceptional omnichannel support to 100+ valued clients and partners in the e-commerce space.



Check out our website: 



Weâ€™re looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Capacity Planner to support our workforce strategy and ensure staffing plans align with forecasted demand across client programs. This role plays a key part in maintaining service levels, optimizing resource utilization, and supporting operational decision-making through accurate forecasting, scheduling insights, and performance analysis. If you enjoy working with data, anticipating business needs, and turning numbers into actionable plans, this is a great opportunity to make a meaningful impact within a fast-paced, remote-first environment.



What Youâ€™ll Be Doing

As a Capacity Planner, you will own the full workforce management cycle: forecasting demand, translating it into staffing and schedules, and then managing the day in real time to protect service levels and labor efficiency. Your role goes beyond â€œmaking schedulesâ€; it includes demand forecasting, resource scheduling, time management, day-of queue management, time-off handling, and scenario planning.



Your Core Responsibilities

**Forecasting and Capacity Planning

- Build short-term and long-range forecasts (typically interval-based) for workload/volume and handle time, then translate forecasts into headcount and capacity requirements.

- Maintain forecast inputs that materially affect staffing: AHT trends, shrinkage assumptions (planned and unplanned), occupancy targets, and seasonality/event effects.

- Track forecast vs actual, quantify forecast accuracy, and perform root-cause analysis when service outcomes miss targets.

- Partner with Operations and cross-functional teams to incorporate â€œexternal factorsâ€ into forecasts (promos, outages, policy changes, new launches, routing changes).



**Staffing Models and Scheduling

- Convert demand into staffing requirements using contact center staffing principles/models (for example, Erlang-based approaches are commonly used to connect volume, handle time, response time, and required staffing).

- Generate schedules that align tea
mber coverage to demand, including work rules, shift types, training/offline activities, and time-off approvals aligned to staffing impact.

- Maintain clean headcount rosters and schedule inputs (skills, queues, sites, credentials) to keep forecasts and schedules reliable.

- Create multiple staffing scenarios when inputs change (hiring delays, attrition, shrinkage shifts, new SLAs), and communicate tradeoffs and risks clearly.



**Intraday Management and Real-Time Control

- Monitor the current dayâ€™s volumes and trends, then adjust schedules accordingly (OT, VTO, skill rebalances, moving offline work, rescheduling shrinkage events).

- Actively manage schedule adherence using real-time adherence concepts (scheduled activity vs actual activity) and coordinate with Ops to correct deviations that threaten SLAs.

- Own an escalation plan and decision thresholds for intraday actions (what triggers action, what actions are allowed, how changes are communicated).



**Reporting, Analytics, and Decision Support

- Produce daily/weekly/monthly performance reporting that ties forecast, coverage, adherence, and service results together for leaders.

- Build and improve reporting templates and dashboards that make trends and risk visible (forecast vs actual, interval performance, attendance/tardiness, overtime drivers).



**Stakeholder Partnership and Planning Culture

- Run regular and ad hoc reviews with Operations and other stakeholders to review staffing models, risks, and mitigation plans.

- Balance business needs with the reality that schedules affect humans (practical, sustainable scheduling and communication).



What Youâ€™ll Bring to the Table

- Proven experience in workforce management and capacity planning within a BPO, e-commerce, or service-driven environment.

- Strong working knowledge of forecasting methodologies, scheduling principles, and intraday management.

- Proficiency in WFM tools (e.g., Verint, Aspect, or similar) and advanced Excel or Google Sheets skills.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

- Clear and effective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate cross-functionally.

- Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet tight deadlines, and stay composed in fast-paced, real-time environments.

- Reliable high-speed internet connection and a dependable computer setup for remote work



Your Core Competencies

- Analytical Thinking: Uses data-driven insights to forecast demand, identify risks, and support workforce decisions.

- Planning & Organization: Translates complex demand signals into structured staffing plans and executable schedules.

- Operational Judgment: Makes sound, timely decisions during intraday fluctuations and SLA risk scenarios.

- Attention to Detail: Ensures forecasts, schedules, rosters, and reports are accurate and reliable.

- Proactivity: Anticipates capacity gaps and acts early to mitigate service and staffing risks.

- Adaptability: Adjusts forecasts and plans quickly in response to changing volumes, priorities, or business needs.

- Communication: Clearly explains workforce insights, tradeoffs, and recommendations to Operations and stakeholders.

- Calm Under Pressure: Maintains focus and decision-making discipline during peak volume periods and real-time escalations.

- Accountability: Takes ownership of workforce outcomes and follows through on commitments.



Whatâ€™s In It For You?

- 100% Remote Work â€“ Work from anywhere in the Philippines

- Leadership Growth â€“ Opportunity to scale your impact and grow within Workforce Operations

- Competitive Pay â€“ $9/hr + benefits as an independent contractor

- Supportive Culture â€“ Collaborate with an experienced and empowering leadership team

- Meaningful Work â€“ Help drive performance outcomes and ensure team success

- Long-Term Stability â€“ Join a growing company that values your career path



Ready to Plan with Precision?

If youâ€™re passionate about forecasting, data-driven decision-making, and turning insights into smart staffing strategies, weâ€™d love to meet you!

title: Commercial Real Estate Acquisitions Analyst (Remote)
description:
About Castle Hill Investments



Castle Hill Investments acquires commercial real estate through online auctions. We provide liquidity in an inefficient market where some sellers need to dispose of property quickly. The barriers (cash required, 30-day close, limited info, no contingencies) keep most buyers away â€” that's our edge.



We're looking for a deal hunter, not a button-pusher.



About the Role



This is not a typical underwriting position. We don't need someone to passively monitor auction sites and hand us spreadsheets. We need someone who will hunt for deals, form opinions, and pitch them to us â€” the way a scout would bring opportunities to an investor.



You'll be the first set of eyes on every potential acquisition. Your job is to find the deals worth our attention, explain why they're interesting, and flag the risks. You'll participate in regular video calls with our leadership team where you present deals and debate strategy. 



To be clear: you won't be originating deals â€” 100% of deal flow comes from published auction listings on sites like Ten-X, Crexi, and RIMarketplace. Your job is to evaluate what's out there, identify the opportunities worth pursuing, and pitch them to leadership.



If you're waiting to be told what to do, this isn't for you. If you want to be in the room where decisions happen, keep reading.



What You'll Do:

-Hunt daily: Monitor Ten-X/LoopNet, Crexi, and RIMarketplace for deals in our target range ($500Kâ€“$2M)

-Form opinions: Don't just flag deals â€” tell us why you like them. "This looks like a value-add play because..." or "I'd pass on this because..."

-Pitch on calls: 3-5x/week video calls where you present new deals, share deeper analysis on yesterday's MAYBEs, and discuss next steps

-Build conviction: When you find a deal you believe in, make the case. Push back if we're skeptical. We want your perspective.

-Build strategy: Youâ€™ll develop how this new business operates alongside leadership.

-Develop into leadership: This role has a clear path to becoming our Head of Acquisitions as the business scales



Who You Are:

-Entrepreneurial mindset â€” You see deals the way an investor does, not the way an employee does

-Opinionated and confident â€” You'll tell us what you think, not just what we want to hear

-Strong communicator â€” You can explain a deal clearly on a video call and in writing

-Commercially aware â€” You understand what makes a property attractive (location, cash flow potential, value-add angles) even with limited information

-Self-directed â€” You'll figure out what needs to happen without waiting for instructions



Requirements:

-Experience in commercial real estate â€” underwriting, brokerage, acquisitions, or similar

-Excellent spoken and written English (you'll be pitching on video calls)

-Comfortable with ambiguity and incomplete information

-Available for Mon/Wed/Fri morning calls (~10-11am CST)

-Full-time availability (40 hrs/week), M-F 10amâ€“7pm CST



Compensation:

-Base: $1,300â€“$1,600/month USD (based on experience and interview performance)

-Performance bonus: Deal identification bonuses when your recommendations convert to acquisitions

-13th month pay, PH holidays, PTO



How to Apply

Send an
 to 
 with:

1. Your resume

2. A 2-minute video introducing yourself. Tell us:

a. Why you want this role (specifically, not generically)

b. A deal or investment you recommended to someone in the past â€” what was it, why did you like it, what happened?



We're not looking for polish. We're looking for someone who thinks like an investor.

title: Tech Support Specialist
description:
Technical Support Specialist (Part-Time, U.S. Hours)

 Hours: 20 hours/week, available 8:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM Pacific Time (California)

 Rate: $10â€“$13/hour USD (based on experience), paid electronically

 Type: Independent contractor, long-term engagement

 Start: Immediate



 About Us

 We are a small AI software company that helps law firms automatically capture and create billing time entries. Our customers are attorneys and legal staff who use our product daily. We're growing and need a dedicated support person to help our customers get the most out of our software.



 What You'll Be Doing



 Customer Support (Primary)

 * Monitor and respond to incoming support
s and chat messages during business hours

 * Troubleshoot customer issues â€” most are configuration, setup, or "how do I do this?" questions

 * Conduct video calls with screen sharing to walk customers through solutions

 * Log every support interaction into our ticketing system with clear notes on the issue, steps taken, and resolution

 * Escalate complex or technical issues to our development team with well-documented details

 * Follow up with customers to confirm issues are resolved



 Onboarding Assistance

 * Help new law firm customers get set up and configured

 * Walk users through initial setup via
, chat, or video call

 * Create and update simple how-to guides or FAQs based on recurring questions



 Quality & Improvement

 * Track common issues and suggest improvements to documentation or product

 * Flag patterns â€” if multiple customers hit the same problem, let us know

 * Help us build out our knowledge base over time



 Who We're Looking For



 Must-haves:

 * Completely fluent English â€” spoken and written. You'll be on video calls with U.S. attorneys and their staff. Your English must be polished and professional in both writing and live conversation.

 * Available 8:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM Pacific Time. This is not full-time active work â€” you need to be responsive and on-call during this window to handle support requests as they come in. Some days will be busy, others quiet. We understand this is late evening / overnight in the Philippines â€” this must genuinely work for your schedule long-term.

 * Patient and empathetic. Our customers are busy professionals who are not always tech-savvy. You need to explain things clearly without talking down to anyone.

 * Strong written communication. Most support is via
 and chat. Your messages need to be clear, professional, and helpful â€” not robotic or overly scripted. We require you use a good LLM like Claude 4.6 to draft responses.  We will pay the $20/month for Claude.

 * Comfortable on video calls. You'll occasionally share screens and walk customers through steps live. A professional appearance, clear audio, and good camera setup are expected.

 * Reliable internet and quiet workspace â€” non-negotiable for calls and consistent availability.

 * Willing to work with AI / LLMs â€” we use AI tools internally and expect you to as well.



 Strong pluses:

 * Prior experience in SaaS or software technical support

 * Experience supporting U.S.-based customers

 * Familiarity with ticketing systems (Zendesk, Freshdesk, Intercom, HubSpot, or similar)

 * Familiarity with the legal industry or legal software (Clio and MyCase)

 * Quick learner â€” comfortable picking up new software without extensive hand-holding

 * Experience creating help documentation or knowledge base articles



 What We Provide

 * Full training on our product â€” you don't need to know it coming in, but you need to learn it quickly

 * Training on our support ticketing system and processes

 * Direct access to our development team for escalations

 * A supportive, small-team environment where your input matters



 Compensation

 * Base rate: $10â€“$13/hour USD, depending on experience

 * Annual review: We revisit the rate annually as the company grows

 * Stability: We're looking for a long-term tea
mber, not a short-term contractor

 * Growth potential: As we grow, this role can expand in scope and compensation



 How to Apply

 Please send:

 1. A short introduction about yourself and why this role interests you

 2. Your experience with technical support, customer service, or SaaS products

 3. Your English proficiency level and any certifications (IELTS, TOEFL, etc.), if available

 4. Confirm that you can be consistently available 8:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM Pacific Time

 5. Your expected hourly rate

 6. A brief sample: Write 3â€“4 sentences as if you were responding to this customer
: "Hi, I just signed up for your software, but I can't figure out how to connect it to my Clio account. Can someone help?"  (Use Claude to draft the response).



We respond to every qualified application within 1 business day.

title: Video Contributor(Iphone 11 or newer and head mount)
description:
This project focuses on collecting first-person (POV) video to train AI and robotics models. As a contributor, you will record POV footage of your everyday household and work activities using a head-mounted iPhone and our specific recording application.

Contributors from any country are welcome to participate. You must already have or be willing to purchase an iPhone 11 or newer and a head-mount for it.



Recording should be done with a head mountâ€”?neck and chest mounts are not acceptable.

Each video you upload must be of a specific task, and NOT a mix of tasks. For example, one video upload should not have you doing both cooking and laundry. Instead, you should record separate videos of cooking and then doing the laundry, and upload both separately.

Ideally, you should record a mix of tasks between 15-30 minutes long.

The space where you record your video should have excellent lighting.

Keep the camera steady with minimal shaking.

All submitted footage must exclude any other individuals' faces unless they directly consent. Additionally, no third party music is permitted in the footage to avoid copyright violations.

No children should appear in the submitted footage.

Minimize external noise during the recordingâ€“especially talkingâ€“so the audio of the task can be captured clearly and keep the camera as steady as possible throughout the recording.

Complete each task from start to finish without walking away or leaving to do another task or take a break.

Tasks should be performed while either standing up, sitting on a chair/stool, not while sitting on the ground.

Perform all activities in a controlled, slow manner.

title: Real Estate Photo Editor/Quality Control
description:
We are seeking an individual who thrives in a collaborative team environment, demonstrates enthusiasm, and takes initiative. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide effective solutions are essential. The ideal candidate should be organized and capable of enhancing our existing systems.



Responsibilities:

Primary responsibility involves meticulously reviewing each image received from our editing house, ensuring consistency and adherence to our brand standards. This entails identifying mistakes or inconsistencies in the editing process to maintain a unified visual style.



If content falls short of our brand standards, the candidate will be required to either send it back with revision requests or make necessary adjustments, including exposure, color correction, cropping, and other enhancements, to ensure a professional and appealing look.



Proficiency in photo editing software such as Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom is a must. A solid understanding of various editing techniques and tools available in these programs is expected.



Effective communication and collaboration with photographers and the scheduling team are crucial. The candidate will closely work with them to comprehend clients' specific requirements, ensuring that the final images align with their vision.



Management and prioritization of a substantial volume of images within tight deadlines is a key responsibility. The candidate should employ efficient workflows and demonstrate strong time management skills to complete editing tasks punctually.



A keen eye for detail is indispensable in identifying and rectifying imperfections or inconsistencies in the images.



Maintenance of an organized file structure and the use of proper naming conventions for edited images are critical. This facilitates easy access, retrieval, and sharing of files with both clients and tea
mbers.



Reach out to clients in a timely manner and effectively response to clients' revision requests is vital for ensuring customer satisfaction.



Required Experience:

Virtual Staging

Proficient in Photoshop and Lightroom

Exposure blending

Luminosity masks

Layer masking

Color correction and grading

Sky replacement

Virtual dusk

--

Tuesday - Saturday 6am-2pm EST

Dont forget to send link of your CVs and  your portfolio. Other candidate forgets that. So dont miss it! :)



In your message  write "I bring magic" in the first sentence of your application letter. This will be our identifier that you have completely read our job post up to the end because we are seeking for the someone who is very keen to details.

We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients, and we are looking for a talented Telecommunications Phone System Technician to join our team.

We are seeking an experienced technician with a strong background in legacy systems like Nortel, Avaya, and NEC, as well as expertise in modern UCaaS (Unified Communications as a Service) solutions and VoIP phone systems such as RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.

Perform system upgrades, patches, and maintenance tasks.

Provide technical support and assistance to clients, both remotely and on-site.

Collaborate with clients to understand their telecommunication needs and recommend solutions.

Assist in the training of end-users on telecommunication systems.

Keep up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in telecommunications.

Qualifications:



Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in telecommunications.

Proficiency in legacy phone systems such as Nortel, Avaya, and NEC EC.

Strong knowledge of UCaaS solutions and VoIP phone systems, including RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.

Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Previous experience with 8x8, RingCentral, Nextiva, or Dialpad is a strong plus.

Industry certifications (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, UCaaS certifications) are a bonus.



Why Join?



Competitive salary and benefits package.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Collaborative and supportive team environment.

Exposure to cutting-edge telecommunications technologies.

Chance to work with a diverse range of clients and industries.

Employee recognition and appreciation programs.

If you are a dedicated Telecommunications Phone System Technician with experince in legacy systems and modern UCaaS/VoIP solutions, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and help us shape the future of business communication.

title: Scope of Work â€“ Virtual Assistant Naturhjerte
description:
We are looking for a warm, grounded, and detail loving Virtual Assistant to join Naturhjerte on a part time basis, approximately 5 to 7 hours per week, with flexibility for additional hours when needed.



This is a role for someone who feels joy in supporting meaningful work. Someone who values structure, precision, and human connection. Someone who wants to contribute to something real and alive.



Naturhjerte is growing, and the right person will grow with us. This is not simply a task based role. It is an opportunity to become part of a mission that touches people deeply and creates lasting impact.



COMPANY & MISSION â€“ Naturhjerte

Naturhjerte is a Norwegian nature based education company founded on the vision of reconnecting people with the wisdom of the sea, the land, and their own bodies.

Our work focuses especially on helping women rediscover ancestral knowledge around seaweed, wild foods, and natural nourishment, and to rebuild trust in nature and themselves.

We offer online programs, memberships, live teachings, and community spaces centered around seaweed foraging, holistic health, and self sufficiency. Our approach combines science, tradition, and lived experience, always guided by integrity, warmth, and care.

Naturhjerte is not just a business. It is a living ecosystem. A place where knowledge is shared, people are supported, and meaningful change happens.

We value presence, responsibility, kindness, and follow through.





THE POSITION â€“ Virtual Assistant

As Virtual Assistant, you play an essential role in supporting the daily rhythm of Naturhjerte. You help bring structure to creative work. You help ensure that our community feels seen, supported, and guided.

You are reliable. You follow through. You care about the details.

You enjoy creating order. You take ownership. You complete what you start.

You are comfortable working independently, while also being part of a close and supportive collaboration.

You do not wait to be reminded. You see what is needed and take initiative.

You understand that every message, every task, and every interaction contributes to the trust people feel toward Naturhjerte.

Core Responsibilities



Community support inside Kajabi

Answering questions, guiding members, and posting updates



Supporting
 communication and newsletters

Assisting with social media posting and scheduling

Organizing documents, spreadsheets, and participant lists

Providing warm and professional client support

Supporting launches, programs, and live teaching periods

Helping maintain structure in weekly workflows

Supporting operational tasks as needed

Time Commitment

Approximately 5 to 7 hours per week

Additional hours may be needed during launches or active program periods

Fully remote position

Flexible working hours, with availability during European daytime hours preferred

The Ideal Person

Fluent in English, written and spoken

Highly structured and detail oriented

Reliable and consistent

Self motivated and able to work independently

Comfortable learning and using digital tools such as Kajabi, Zoom, Google Drive, Canva, and
 platforms and Monday

Warm and professional in communication

Service minded and caring toward community members

Able to follow instructions carefully and complete tasks fully

Aligned with Naturhjerteâ€™s mission and values

Interest in nature, health, food, sustainability, or community work is a strong advantage

This role is well suited for someone who appreciates meaningful work and wants to contribute to something with depth and purpose.

It is not about doing more. It is about doing what matters, with presence and care.

For the right person, this can become a long term collaboration with growing responsibility and trust.



Naturhjerte is built on relationships. We are looking for someone who wants to grow roots here.

title: Cold Outreach Specialist â€” AI Terminal App (Waitlist Growth)
description:
ABOUT COSYRA

Cosyra is an AI-powered terminal app that lets developers run real terminal workflows from their phone â€” SSH, CLI, AI-assisted terminal tasks, and more. We're growing fast and need someone laser-focused on one thing: getting developers to sign up for our waitlist.



This is NOT a community management or social media posting role. This is a proactive outreach role. You will be reaching out directly to people, publications, and creators to get Cosyra in front of as many developers as possible.



YOUR ONE GOAL

Drive as many qualified waitlist signups as possible every single week.



WHAT YOU'LL DO



1. Cold Outreach (60% of your time)

- Send 15-25 personalized outreach messages per day across
, LinkedIn,
/X, and Reddit

-
 AI newsletter owners, tech bloggers, and developer-focused publications to get Cosyra featured or mentioned

- DM AI influencers, developer advocates, YouTube creators, and podcasters with collaboration proposals

- Reach out to developers, DevOps engineers, and AI enthusiasts on LinkedIn with personalized messages

- Engage authentically on Reddit, Hacker News, and developer forums where Cosyra solves a real problem

- Follow up systematically â€” most replies come on the 2nd or 3rd follow-up



2. Paid Advertising Research (20% of your time)

- Research and identify paid sponsorship opportunities in AI/tech newsletters (e.g., TLDR, ByteByteGo, etc.)

- Find developer communities, 
 servers, and forums that offer paid promotions or pinned posts

- Source podcast and YouTube sponsorship opportunities with creators in the AI/dev tools space

- Present a weekly summary of paid opportunities with pricing, audience size, and your recommendation

- Coordinate and manage bookings for approved paid placements



3. Tracking & Reporting (20% of your time)

- Maintain a clean, organized outreach tracker in Google Sheets (who you contacted, channel, response, result)

- Provide a weekly report: outreach sent, responses received, waitlist signups generated, paid opportunities found

- Track which messaging angles and channels are producing the best results

- Continuously test and improve your outreach based on data



WHAT WE EXPECT

- Consistent daily output â€” this role requires discipline and follow-through

- Respect all platform rules â€” no spam, no mass blasting, no automation bots

- Creative problem-solving â€” find new channels and angles to get Cosyra in front of developers

- Honest, transparent reporting â€” we care about real numbers, not vanity metrics



NON-NEGOTIABLE RULES

- NO mass DM blasting or automated scraping tools

- NO spammy outreach â€” every message must be personalized and genuine

- You must follow platform rules strictly to avoid getting accounts flagged or banned

- If an approach isn't working, tell us â€” don't just keep doing the same thing



REQUIREMENTS

- Proven experience in cold outreach, lead generation, or business development

- Excellent written English â€” your messages need to sound natural, conversational, and not templated

- Comfortable using
, LinkedIn,
/X, and Reddit daily for outreach

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail for tracking and follow-ups

- Self-starter who can work independently and hit weekly targets without constant supervision

- Familiarity with researching paid advertising and sponsorship opportunities



NICE TO HAVE

- Experience with outreach tools (
, Apollo, Lemlist, LinkedIn Sales Navigator)

- Understanding of developer communities and what resonates with technical audiences

- Previous experience growing a waitlist or doing launch outreach for a SaaS/tech product

- Knowledge of AI tools like Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, Replit, etc.

- Experience evaluating and booking newsletter or podcast sponsorships



TOOLS YOU'LL USE

- Google Sheets (Required â€” for tracking all outreach)

- LinkedIn (Required)

-
/X and Reddit (Required)

-
 (Gmail or similar)

- Optional: 
, Apollo, Lemlist, or similar outreach tools



COMPENSATION

$400/month for 20 hours/week (approximately $5/hour). Performance bonuses available based on waitlist signup milestones â€” the more signups you drive, the more you earn.



HOW TO APPLY

Please include the following in your application:

1. A brief summary of your cold outreach or lead generation experience (who did you reach out to, what channels, what results?)

2. Write a sample outreach DM (2-3 sentences) you would send to an AI YouTuber asking them to feature Cosyra

3. Your weekly availability and preferred working hours

title: Airbnb Guest Communication Manager
description:
Job Description:

Iâ€™m looking for a reliable, emotionally intelligent Virtual Assistant to support me with guest communication across multiple Airbnb short-term rental properties.

Youâ€™ll be a key part of ensuring our guests feel cared for, informed, and supported - from first inquiry through to checkout.

I will provide full training, systems, templates, and ongoing support.

I will need someone to assist with the following forms of guest communications:



1) Responding to guest inquiries in a way that makes them feel special and want to book a stay with us

2) Communicating with booked guests to provide any necessary information prior to their stay

3) Communicating briefly with guests during their stay to ensure that they are comfortable

4) Proactively managing any issues with the guest, property or clients 





Forms of communication:



1) Airbnb Chat

2) Text/Whatsapp 

3)

4) Phone (potentially)





Required skills:



1) Emotional intelligence: It will be necessary to communicate effectively, build rapport, and make guests feel special.



2) Amazing problem solving skills: It will be necessary to learn to solve problems and become independent with training.



3) Ability to follow systems: It will be necessary to follow a system in order to provide a consistent customer experience.



4) Proactivity. If an issue comes up, youâ€™ll need to proactively manage it given all our contacts & training. Give me examples of what youâ€™ve done all of the above. 



5) Exceptional written English skills



6) Customer Service, Customer Support,
 handling, Chat support



7) You will be trained on when to resolve issues independently and when to escalate to me. I value good judgement over perfection. 



Important note:  Start your response by telling me what colour the sky is. 



Other Details:

Online between 9am - 9pm AEST. You need to respond in under 3 minutes when a guest messages. 

You need reliable internet access and a backup plan for outages, as guest communication is time-sensitive. 

More than 6 months (Project length) 

Intermediate Level (I am looking for a mix of experience and value) 

Start date - March 2026

This role can be combined with other work, provided responsiveness and availability during rostered hours is not impacted. Applicant must not work for another Airbnb / short-term rental manager. 

There will be a paid 2â€“4 week trial period to ensure weâ€™re a great fit on both sides.





This job is perfect for someone who: 

genuinely enjoys helping people

stays calm when problems arise

likes following systems but can think independently

takes pride in excellent communication

wants a long-term role, not a quick gig





What This Role Actually Involves (Day-to-Day Reality)

While a large part of this role involves guest communication, itâ€™s important to understand what that really looks like in practice.

Guests contact us for a wide range of reasons. Many are repetitive and straightforward (check-in questions, Wi-Fi details, early check-in requests), however others require real-time problem solving and calm decision-making.

Youâ€™ll often be:

Handling similar questions across multiple properties with consistency and warmth

Reassuring guests when something doesnâ€™t go to plan

Thinking on your feet when unexpected issues arise

At times, the role also involves coordinating on-the-ground support, which may include:

Finding and contacting tradespeople or service providers online

Vetting availability, pricing, and suitability

Liaising with property owners to get approval if required 

Coordinating access to the property

Staying across the job while itâ€™s in progress

Confirming the issue has been resolved properly and that the property is left clean and guest-ready

You wonâ€™t be expected to know how to do all of this immediately - full training, systems, and trusted contacts are provided. However, this role suits someone who is comfortable:

staying online while an issue is being resolved

following a clear process

taking ownership until a task is fully complete

If you enjoy problem-solving, helping people, and seeing things through from start to finish, youâ€™ll thrive in this role.





Screening Question:



**Please respond to this "guest inquiry" as you feel is appropriate**



Hi, 



My friends and I are visiting Melbourne for the weekend and would like to stay at your place! It looks to be in a great location. Is it possible to get an early check-in? 



Jill

title: UGC Web Developer
description:
UGC Creator Portal â€“ Airtable + Softr Build for Growth Agency

About Us

We run a UGC growth agency working with consumer tech brands. We manage multiple creators producing content daily for different clients. We're currently managing workflows manually and need a streamlined creator portal to scale our operations efficiently.

What We Need Built

The Problem We're Solving

Right now, our content submission, approval, and performance tracking processes are scattered across 
,
, and spreadsheets. We need a centralized system where:



Creators can see available jobs and submit content in one organized place

Our team can approve/deny submissions with clear feedback loops

Content automatically organizes into client-specific folders

We can track creator performance without manual data entry



What You'll Build

Creator-Facing Portal (Softr):



Secure login system (each creator has their own account)

Job board showing available campaigns with details (client, requirements, pay, deadline)

Content upload interface where creators submit videos with metadata (campaign name, concept, TikTok/IG links)

Submission history view (pending, approved, denied status)

Basic earnings/stats dashboard



Admin Portal (Softr):



Separate admin login for our team

Job posting interface (create new campaigns, assign to creators)

Content review queue (approve/deny with feedback notes)

Dashboard showing: pending submissions, approval rates, turnaround times by creator

Client overview (see all content by client)



Backend Database (Airtable):



Creators table (contact info, social handles, performance metrics, payment details)

Jobs/Campaigns table (client name, requirements, budget, deadline, status)

Content Submissions table (linked to creators and jobs, approval status, video URLs, view counts)

Clients table (contact info, active campaigns, content library)

Properly linked relational database structure



Automations (Zapier or 
):



When content is approved ? save video link to Google Drive in correct client folder

When content is uploaded ? notify assigned account manager

When content is denied ? notify creator with feedback

Weekly digest
 summarizing pending approvals



Must-Have Features



Mobile-responsive (creators will access from phones)

Clean, professional UI (represents our brand to creators)

Role-based permissions (creators see only their stuff, admins see everything)

File organization system that mirrors our Google Drive structure

Notification system (
 alerts for key actions)



Nice-to-Have Features



Bulk upload capability for multiple videos at once

Filtering/search functionality (by client, by creator, by date, by status)

Basic analytics dashboard (submission volume over time, top performers)

Integration with payment tracking (so we can log what we've paid creators)



What We're Looking For

Required Experience:



Proven experience building Airtable databases with relational structures

Experience building client portals or login systems using Softr

Comfortable with Zapier or 
 for workflow automation

Strong understanding of user experience (this needs to be intuitive for non-technical users)

Portfolio showing similar projects you've completed



Bonus Points:



Experience working with content creators or agencies

Understanding of Google Drive API integration

Experience with performance tracking dashboards

Knowledge of TikTok/Instagram API for pulling view counts (optional future phase)



Deliverables

title: Virtual Assistant â€“ Email, Vendor Support & Customer Messaging
description:
The
, Vendor Support & Customer Messaging is the primary point of contact for vendor partners. This role is responsible for managing the entire vendor lifecycle, from initial invitation and onboarding to daily support, promotional coordination, and contract management. The ideal candidate is highly organized, possesses exceptional written and verbal communication skills, and is adept at professional de-escalation and problem-solving. 



Key Responsibilities



1. Vendor Onboarding and Contract Management

Manage the vendor pipeline from application review through final agreement signing.

Prepare and send official communications, including the Onboarding Confirmation, Vendor Agreement, and Welcome/Payment Confirmation
s.

Ensure all new vendors are properly onboarded, including checking for receipt of signed agreements and initial rent payments.

Approve and grant access to the Vendor Portal App for new partners.



2. Daily Support and Logistics

Serve as the main point of contact for all vendor inquiries, including questions related to restocking (remote/courier), product display, and sales reporting.

Manage physical shelf logistics, ensuring vendors adhere to approved dimensions (18â€ W x 18â€ D x 10â€ H) and storage policies (e.g., maximum two Dollarama boxes).

Address and resolve issues regarding inventory collateral and in-store setup appointments.



3. Financial and Administrative Management

Monitor monthly rent payments and follow up on late or missing payments.

Process and confirm e-transfers and other forms of payment, maintaining accurate financial records.

Prepare final sales statements and process security deposit returns for exiting vendors.



4. Promotional Coordination

Initiate and coordinate vendor participation in social media and marketing campaigns (e.g., Request for Short Video & Photos for Vendor Promotion).

Maintain and update official asset links (e.g., Canva templates, Google Drive upload folders).

Track and manage the status of promotional asset submissions, following up with vendors to ensure timely receipt of content.



5. High-Risk Conflict and Withdrawal Management

Process all vendor withdrawal notices, checking for compliance with the 4-month minimum commitment and 30 days' notice period.

Implement the Hostile Withdrawal Protocol: Immediately escalate high-risk complaints, offer sincere written apologies, and negotiate exceptional, expedited exit terms (e.g., waiving the 30-day notice) to mitigate public relations risk.



Required Qualifications

Experience: Minimum 2 years of experience in account management, customer service, or retail operations is an asset, preferably supporting small businesses or vendors.



Communication: Exceptional written communication skills ( English Language) with proven experience in professional
 drafting and conflict de-escalation.

Technical Proficiency: High proficiency in Google Workspace (Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets) and familiarity with Vendor/CRM software.



Skills: High attention to detail for contract , excellent organizational skills, and a strong sense of empathy and professional tact.



Decision-Making: Demonstrated ability to make quick, judicious decisions under pressure, particularly when balancing contractual requirements with reputational risk.



Work Schedule



Approximately 2 hours per day ( Potential to increase depending on need )



Split shift:



1 hour in the morning



1 hour in the evening

(Mondayâ€“Friday, flexible timing within agreed hours)

?

s, and follow-ups

?

?

?

?

 1. Your experience with grants or funding

?



???? Why This Is the Right Framing

Additional duties include digital marketing assistant, graphic design, lead generation campaigns, LinkedIn engagement, setting appointments, and collaborating with the team to develop effective systems and processes are also crucial aspects of this role. We value initiative and creativity in finding innovative ways to engage with potential leads.

, and other communication platforms to initiate contact with prospects. â€¢ Work with the team to develop and refine outreach strategies to increase response rates.

title: Senior U.S. Bankruptcy Drafter â€“ Chapter 7 & 13 (Remote)
description:
We are hiring an experienced U.S. Bankruptcy professional to join our team full-time. This is a remote position.



We are looking for a strong senior drafter who can independently move cases from preparation through confirmation and discharge with minimal oversight.



This role is for someone who understands U.S. bankruptcy deeply and knows how to get cases to the finish line.



About the Role



You will work on Chapters 7 and 13 cases and be responsible for ensuring files are properly drafted, amended when needed, and strategically positioned for approval.



Responsibilities



â€¢ Draft and review Chapter 7 and Chapter 13 petitions

â€¢ Prepare and amend schedules and statements

â€¢ Draft Chapter 13 plans

â€¢ Review trustee objections and prepare amendments

â€¢ Identify feasibility and disposable income issues

â€¢ Calculate income and expense adjustments accurately

â€¢ Monitor deadlines and ensure cases stay on track

â€¢ Communicate clearly with internal staff



What Weâ€™re Looking For



â€¢ 3+ years working on U.S. bankruptcy cases

â€¢ Strong experience with both Chapter 7 and Chapter 13

â€¢ Ability to draft plans and handle amendments confidently

â€¢ Detail-oriented and deadline-driven

â€¢ Comfortable with high-volume workflow

â€¢ Independent and solutions-focused



This is not an entry-level position. We are looking for someone reliable, accurate, and able to carry cases through the process.



Compensation



Monthly salary: $2,800 â€“ $3,500 depending on experience and output.



Full-time position (40 hours per week). Long-term opportunity.



To Apply



Please include:



1. Detailed description of your U.S. bankruptcy experience

2. Years working on Chapters 7 and 13

3. Examples of schedules, petitions, or plans you have drafted (redacted)

4. Your expected monthly salary

5. Your availability



We are looking for someone who takes ownership of cases and takes pride in getting them across the finish line.

description:

â€¢ Drafting and reviewing Chapter 7 petitions and schedules

â€¢ Assisting with Chapter 11 filings where applicable

â€¢ Reviewing financial documentation and calculating income/expenses

â€¢ Identifying feasibility and compliance issues before filing

â€¢ Preparing amendments in response to trustee objections

We are a high-volume firm with structured systems and clear workflow. We value professionals who are organized, proactive, and take pride in precision.

â€¢ 2+ years of U.S. debtor-side bankruptcy experience

â€¢ Comfortable drafting and amending schedules independently

â€¢ Detail-oriented and deadline-driven

â€¢ Able to manage case volume without sacrificing accuracy

â€¢ Clear communicator who takes ownership of work

Compensation

Full-time position (40 hours per week). Long-term opportunity with growth potential based on performance.

title: Part-Time Amazon Brand Manager
description:
